str2: Most of all, especially. Neuter plural of the superlative of an apparently primary adverb mala; most or particularly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
One who knows, an expert. From ginosko; a knower.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
A custom, habit; an institute, rite. From etho; a usage.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
A question, subject of inquiry, dispute. From zeteo; a search, i.e. a debate.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To want for myself; I want, need; I beg, request, beseech, pray. Middle voice of deo; to beg, i.e. Petition.
Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.
To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
With longsuffering, patiently. Adverb of a compound of makros and thumos; with long temper, i.e. Leniently.
